metadata.title: CVE-2018-11763 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4.17 to 2.4.34, by sending continuous, largeSETTINGS frames a client can occupy a connection, server thread and CPUtime without any connection timeout coming to effect. This affects onlyHTTP/2 connections. A possible mitigation is to not enable the h2 protocol.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11763` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4').
